edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree

Class BinarySearchTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree.BinarySearchTree<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the generic element type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dictionary<E>, Tree<E>

    public class BinarySearchTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Dictionary<E>, Tree<E>
    Class that represents the binary search tree data structure. Specifically, the binary search tree uses the 2-3 tree implementation design, which is a generalization of the typical binary search tree, and as such, maintains the typical search properties and operations. Note that the generic type E extends Comparable of a generic type, which was referenced from the SortedArrayList class from project 3 of CSC216. The authors of the class were Austin Hyder and Jimmy Nguyen.
    Author:
    Jimmy Nguyen

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.String k,
                   E e)
        Adds an element and its corresponding key to the binary search tree. If the given key or element is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown. If the element and key will not be added to the root, then the insert method that takes a node as the additional parameter value is called.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Dictionary<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Tree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
        Parameters:
        k - the key to add to the binary search tree
        e - the element to add to the binary search tree
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given key or element is null

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.String k,
                   E e,
                   edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree.BinarySearchTree.Node pn)
        A recursive algorithm that helps add the given key and element to the binary search tree. If adding the key exceeds the maximum number of keys allowed for the 2-3 tree implementation, then the split recursive algorithm is called to resolve overflow. If the given key is a duplicate, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        k - the key to add to the binary search tree
        e - the element to add to the binary search tree
        pn - the parent node
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given key is a duplicate

      • split

        public void split(java.lang.String k,
                  E e,
                  edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree.BinarySearchTree.Node pn)
        A recursive algorithm that splits a node into 2 nodes, and the middle key is moved up to the parent node. If there is still an overflow, then the split method is recursively called.
        Parameters:
        k - the key to add to the binary search tree
        e - the element to add to the binary search tree
        pn - the parent node

      • remove

        public E remove(java.lang.String k)
        Removes the element and key from the binary search tree based on the given key. Returns the element that was removed from the list, or null if the element was not found. If the given key is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Tree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
        Parameters:
        k - the key to remove the element and associated key from the tree
        Returns:
        the removed element or null if the element was not found
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given key is null

      • remove

        public E remove(java.lang.String k,
                edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree.BinarySearchTree.Node node)
        A recursive algorithm that helps search for the key in the binary search tree and remove the element and associated key. If removing the key from the tree results in an underflow, then either the fusion or transfer operation is performed to resolve underflow.
        Parameters:
        k - the key to remove the element and associated key from the tree
        node - the current node
        Returns:
        the removed element or null if the element was not found

      • findSuccessor

        public edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree.BinarySearchTree.Node findSuccessor(edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree.BinarySearchTree.Node node)
        A recursive algorithm that helps find the in-order successor of the given node. Returns the node that contains the keys and elements. If the given node is null, then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        node - the current node to find the in-order successor for
        Returns:
        the node that contains the keys and elements that are in-order successor or null if the node is null

      • fusion

        public void fusion(edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree.BinarySearchTree.Node node)
        A recursive algorithm that helps update the binary search tree when an element and key to remove are found through fusion.
        Parameters:
        node - the current node

      • transfer

        public void transfer(edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree.BinarySearchTree.Node node)
        A recursive algorithm that helps update the binary search tree when an element and key to remove are found through transferring.
        Parameters:
        node - the current node

      • lookUp

        public E lookUp(java.lang.String k)
        Returns the element from the binary search tree based on the given key. Returns null if the element was not found. If the given key is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        lookUp in interface Dictionary<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the element found or null if the element was not found
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given key is null

      • lookUp

                edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree.BinarySearchTree.Node node)
        A recursive algorithm that searches for the element based on the given key value and returns the element from the binary search tree. Returns null if the element was not found.
        Parameters:
        k - the key value to search for
        node - the current node
        Returns:
        the element found or null if the element was not found

      • elementsInLevelOrder

        public java.lang.String elementsInLevelOrder()
        Returns a String of all the elements in the tree through level order traversal. This method is used to help see the shape and contents of the 2 3 tree implementation. Note that the level-order traversal algorithm is referenced from the CSC316 Tree lecture slides on page 22, provided by Jason King.
        Returns:
        the String representation of all the elements in the tree
